title.narrative: 6.1. INCLUSIVE SOCIAL POLICIES & PROTECT

description.narrative: 6.1. Strengthened national capacity to design, plan and budget for child-sensitive and inclusive social policies and social protection, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Economic And Social Policy General, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Disadvantaged children increasingly benefit from an improved policy environment and systems guided by quality research and data.

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Delivery of cash transfers or voucher through new and/or parallel system (humanitarian context)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: General Economic, Commercial and Labour Affairs policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 6.1. Strengthened national capacity to design, plan and budget for child-sensitive and inclusive social policies and social protection

description.narrative: Following the finalization of the 2017-2022 National Social Development Sector Strategy, MoSD, in partnership with key actors in social protection, initiated social protection reform and system strengthening based on the new, innovative national poverty framework. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Availability of national sex disaggregated data on child rights realisation, including data on CWD

target.value: 2017:Yes, National Youth Survey, Situation Analysis for Children with Disabilities,

actual.value: 2016:Met: Disability SitAn to be launched 5 Dec. National Youth Survey completed and disseminated. Preparation for PECS with new multidimensional poverty indicators ongoing

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existence of advocacy and engagement to place child poverty as a national priority

actual.value: 2016:On-track. A Multiple Overlapping Deprivation Analysis was undertake as an evidence-based advocacy tool to include child poverty in the national child poverty measurement as well as the national social protection strategy.

title.narrative: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy

actual.value: 2017:Fully achieved: The new Social Development Sector Strategy was finalized and endorsed by the Council of Ministers in June 2017.

title.narrative: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy

actual.value: 2017:On-Track: Strategy was prepared and is currently in the review process
